mods.abstract: Correspondence, minute papers, and memoranda concerning financial assistance given to the Government of Persia by the governments of Britain and Russia. The papers form part of the discussion of practical and routine aspects of transferring the money to Persia, including a proposal to switch the currency of payments from Tomans to Sterling.The correspondence is principally between officials at the India Office and Foreign Office but further correspondence, usually included as enclosures, comes from officials at the Treasury, British Legation in Tehran, and the Government of Persia.
